nodes.title: Build receipt printer management suite
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"User asked: make a receipt printer management suite that works on macOS and Linux, starting with a simple GUI in Rust for pasting text to print. Must support Epson TM-T88VI and TM-M50 via USB. No image support yet. Needs connection keep-alive and platform-specific USB handling."}

nodes.title: Choose GUI framework
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":95,"prompt":"User chose iced over egui/eframe and tauri. Offered 3 options: egui (recommended for simplicity), iced (Elm-inspired, better for growing complexity), tauri (web-based). User selected iced."}

nodes.title: Choose printer communication method
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":95,"prompt":"User chose raw ESC/POS over USB. Options were: raw ESC/POS (recommended, more control), CUPS (simpler but less control), or both with auto-detect. User selected raw ESC/POS."}

nodes.title: Choose connection type for Phase 1
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"User said USB and Bluetooth, but agreed to punt on Bluetooth and get USB working first."}

nodes.title: egui/eframe - immediate mode, pure Rust, lightest weight, recommended for simple tools
iced - Elm-inspired model-update-view, structured, good for growing complexity (SELECTED)
tauri - web UI with Rust backend, most flexible styling but adds web framework overhead
Raw ESC/POS over USB - direct USB comms, more control, no driver deps (SELECTED)
CUPS - OS print system, simpler setup but less formatting control
Both raw USB + CUPS with auto-detect fallback

Research: nusb is the modern USB crate - has hotplug Stream for connect/disconnect events, async+blocking APIs, cross-platform. Better than rusb for our use case because of built-in hotplug monitoring.

Research: escpos crate v0.17 has native_usb feature that internally uses nusb via NativeUsbDriver. This means we get ESC/POS protocol + USB transport in one integration. We use nusb directly only for hotplug detection.

Research: Epson USB Vendor ID is 0x04b8. Product IDs for TM-T88VI and TM-M50 are not well-documented publicly - need to verify against actual hardware. App includes fallback to accept any Epson VID device.

Platform difference: macOS may have CUPS/Epson driver claiming USB interface before us, blocking raw access. Mitigation: advise user to remove printer from System Settings. Linux needs udev rules for non-root USB access and user in plugdev/lp group.
Architecture: separation of concerns

Architecture: 3-layer design - GUI (iced app.rs), Printer layer (printer/ module with discovery, connection, models, status), Platform layer (platform/ with macos.rs, linux.rs conditional compilation). Clean separation means we can swap GUI or add Bluetooth without rewriting printer logic.
Use NativeUsbDriver from escpos crate for printing, nusb directly only for hotplug

Phase 1 scope: text-only printing with basic formatting (bold/underline/double-size), auto-detect, hotplug, status indicator, platform checks. Defer: images, Bluetooth, real-time DLE EOT status, templates, print queue, barcodes.
Risk: Product ID table incomplete - exact PIDs for TM-T88VI/TM-M50 not reliably documented. Mitigated by fallback accepting any Epson VID device and logging unknown PIDs for discovery.
Risk: macOS driver conflicts - CUPS may claim USB interface before us. Mitigated by clear error messaging to remove printer from System Settings.
Risk: iced 0.14 API instability - API changed significantly between 0.12/0.13/0.14. Plan targets 0.14 specifically using application() builder pattern, not older Application trait.
Risk: Blocking USB I/O in async context. NativeUsbDriver is blocking but print jobs are short (~100ms). iced with tokio feature runs Task::perform on thread pool. Acceptable for Phase 1.
Initialize Cargo project with cargo init
Cargo project initialized, edition set to 2021, all deps resolved: iced 0.13.1, escpos 0.17, nusb 0.2.2, tokio, thiserror, tracing
Used iced 0.13.1 not 0.14 - plan originally said 0.14 but cargo resolved 0.13.1 as latest stable. API uses application() builder with title/update/view fns and run_with() for custom init.
Create module structure: error.rs, printer/{mod,models,discovery,connection,status}.rs, platform/{mod,macos,linux}.rs, assets/udev/99-epson-receipt.rules
All modules created successfully - error types, printer models/discovery/connection/status, platform checks for macOS and Linux, udev rules
Implement iced GUI app: App state, Message enum, update/view/theme/subscription functions, hotplug watcher stream
First cargo build attempt
Build failed with 2 errors: (1) escpos feed() takes no args, need feeds(n) instead. (2) nusb::list_devices() returns MaybeFuture, needs .wait() before .map_err()
escpos API: feed() takes no args (feeds 1 line), feeds(n) takes line count. Chaining returns Result<&mut Self>. Methods: init(), bold(), underline(), size(), writeln(), feeds(), print_cut()

nusb API: list_devices() returns impl MaybeFuture, must call .wait() for blocking or .await for async. watch_devices() returns Result directly (not MaybeFuture). NativeUsbDriver::open(vid, pid) takes only 2 args.
Fix build errors: feed(3)->feeds(3), add nusb::MaybeFuture import and .wait() call, fix product_string() type mismatch (&str vs String)
Second build succeeded - compiles clean with only dead_code warnings for unused error types and status module (expected, used later)
First runtime test with cargo run

Runtime panic: 'scrollable content must not fill its vertical scrolling axis' - text_editor with height(Length::Fill) inside scrollable() causes conflict in iced 0.13. text_editor handles its own scrolling.
Fix scrollable panic: remove scrollable() wrapper around text_editor, use fixed height(400) instead of Length::Fill, remove unused scrollable import
Phase 1 codebase committed - 15 files, iced GUI with ESC/POS USB printing, hotplug, formatting, platform checks
Scrollable panic fixed - text_editor uses height(400) without scrollable wrapper, builds and runs clean
Runtime test passed - app launches, GUI renders, auto-scan detected TM-T88VI (VID=04b8 PID=0202) on USB. No panics.
Hardware confirmed: TM-T88VI product ID is 0x0202. This resolves the incomplete PID table risk (node 19). PID is now verified against actual hardware.
Mitigate macOS CUPS driver conflicts - CUPS may claim USB interface before raw ESC/POS access
Complete Epson Product ID table - verify PIDs for TM-M50 and other models against hardware
Address iced 0.13 API differences from planned 0.14 - track breaking changes and migration path
Implement macOS CUPS conflict detection - check lpstat for claimed Epson printers, dynamic warnings, better open-failure errors
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":85,"prompt":"lets especially focus on CUPS stuff for mac OS"}

nodes.title: CUPS detection implemented - lpstat parsing, dynamic warnings, conflict-aware USB open errors, 5 unit tests passing
Rich text markdown editor with preview, TDD, pre-commit hooks
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"is there a rust library we could drop in that is for text input that we could use here?
I want to have like, maybe it support some limited subset of markdown?
i also want it to have a lighter theme, make it look like a Mac OS app, and be pretty and well thought out
it should also make a newline when you hit the character width limit for the size you are in
we should be able to apply the sizes and styles to just one line or character or word etc
if it splits a word it should put the word on the newline, too, like never cut off a word
we also should create pre commit hooks that ensure clippy + formatter have run, and that all tests pass. we should emphasize building in a TDD based fashion but base the tests on the real world and if its working or not etc with real ideas, not assumptions. we want to also make this eventually be quite extended so its important to have a good core. we should emphasize the tests and write pure, composable functions that push complexity to the edges, in the interface with the real world. we should test those functions in isolation as well as test their composition"}

nodes.title: Implemented receipt markdown parser with pulldown-cmark
Implemented word wrapper with never-split-words
Implemented pure ESC/POS command generator
Rewrote GUI: side-by-side markdown+preview, macOS light theme
35 tests pass, clippy clean, app launches with side-by-side layout, light theme, printer detected
Fix printer disappearance on macOS - auto-detect disconnect, clean up, rescan
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":85,"prompt":"the app was open and running and it didnt catch the mac losing the printer, and gave no meaningful errors --- we should actively be looking to see if the printer \"disappears\" and if it does clean up USB re-scan and detect it. This problem is constant on mac OS"}

nodes.title: Add periodic printer health check and disconnect-aware hotplug handling for macOS
Periodic health check every 5s catches macOS USB disconnects. Uses iced time::every subscription alongside hotplug watcher.
Fix word splitting in preview - words being split mid-character by iced rich_text re-wrapping

{"branch":"main","confidence":95,"prompt":"the word splitting doesnt work, fix that and write a test

this was my input: whats up buttercup we are gonna attempt the word splitting situation now and see what happens

Now, the first lines:
Whats up buttercup we are gonna attempt th
e word
splitting situation now and see what happe
ns

The line break from --- had 6 -s bleed onto the next line"}

nodes.title: Set Wrapping::None on rich_text preview + add never_splits_words_real_input test

Fixed - word_wrap logic was already correct (never splits words), issue was iced rich_text re-wrapping at container pixel boundary. Added Wrapping::None to prevent iced from re-wrapping. 36 tests pass.
Printer width is 42 chars, not 48 - Epson TM-T88VI with default margins has 42 usable chars per line, not the spec's 48
Add image printing support
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":95,"prompt":"now lets get images working. we should be able to take an image and just pass it along and print it. We should always scale the image appropriately (we can use python for this...its fine, its got PIL and rust it would be harder most likely) and we will need to do some dithering too, floyd steinberg should suffice"}

nodes.title: Use escpos graphics feature + image crate
Python/PIL preprocessing + raw ESC/POS raster via printer.custom()
Use Python/PIL for image preprocessing, raw ESC/POS raster
Implemented image printing pipeline
42 tests passing, image pipeline complete
Add drag-and-drop image support to GUI
Integrate website message polling and printing
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"lets now add an ability to integrate with my website. It is at ../blog

there is an old page that is for doing this but its code is terrible

steal its STYLES and nothing else, and make a new page

that page should support adding images and text to the document

it will then have them sent to me here on the mac

and then we will print their messages

actuallyyyyy try to work with what is there nevermind

lets have you really do it this way: you are doing a process where you tap into the exact API already there and get its messages, and print both photos and images using this repository. You're replacing the existing work.

This will entail copying the .env from ../blog and ../receipts so i will grab those"}

nodes.title: Implemented website message poller with image printing
Build succeeds, 43 tests pass (36 original + 7 new)
Fix FAIL status bug + image preview in messages panel
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"lets get website polling feature where we preview images if they are sent along with a message working\n\nalso this says it failed but it printed!"}

nodes.title: Fix FAIL bug + image preview + deduplication
Fixed FAIL bug + image preview + deduplication

Image printing bug: escpos bit_image_from_bytes_option likely resets printer state (ESC @), clearing buffered text. Fix: serve images via URL instead of base64, download separately in Rust, and print text+image in correct order.
URL-based image pipeline: blog serves images at /api/receipt_messages/:id/image, Rust downloads via HTTP, text+image print isolated with separate init cycles
Fix image dithering for thermal printing
nodes.metadata_json: {"branch":"main","confidence":90,"prompt":"the images coming out from the web look like ass the dithering is all wrong, can we fix that?"}

nodes.title: Implement Floyd-Steinberg dithering + gamma correction for thermal printing
Committed: polling + URL images + dithering module
